item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“Jamian, post:5, topic:428892”]So for the “./DIRECTORY/TO/YOUR/SERVER” do i just put where my source files are located?
(they’re in a file on my desktop)

and once i do that, is this what it should look like?

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\bin\javac.exe” -d ./Class/ Java/.java Java/sign/.java
cd ./DIRECTORY/TO/YOUR/SERVER
javac *.java
pause[/quote]

yes and no. for one, you are calling javac.exe twice. you also have some wrong parts. if you have two folders called Java and Class (assuming Java is where all the .java files are and Class is where all the .class files are) do this:

@echo off

"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\bin\javac.exe" -d ./Class/ ./Java/*.java ./Java/sign/*.java
pause

folder setup:

Server/ compile.bat ./Java ./Class
Java/ main.java class1.java class2.java
Class/ main.class class1.class class2.class

Read full topic

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @Jamian Jamian
item.description:
@Jamian wrote:

So for the “./DIRECTORY/TO/YOUR/SERVER” do i just put where my source files are located?
(they’re in a file on my desktop)

and once i do that, is this what it should look like?

@echo off
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.6.0_30\bin\javac.exe” -d ./Class/ Java/.java Java/sign/.java
cd ./DIRECTORY/TO/YOUR/SERVER
javac *.java
pause

item.title: Compiler issue
item.dc:creator: @lemme_winks lemme_winks_
item.description:
@lemme_winks wrote:

[quote=“Jamian, post:3, topic:428892”][quote author=lemme_winks_ link=topic=531589.msg3884356#msg3884356 date=1326317202]
did you ever consider setting your sourcepath or cd’ing into it?
[/quote]

To be honest with you… i have no idea what that means or how i would go about doing that.[/quote]

use the advice that the compiler gave you: javac -help.

to elaborate, you are invoking cmd.exe through a script. so you need to take the same approach as if you were using the command line/terminal. an example:

via cmd line
cd ./DIRECTORY/TO/MY/SERVER

assuming you are using windows, you won’t have to worry about case-sensitivity.

via script IE: compile.bat

@echo off

cd ./DIRECTORY/TO/YOUR/SERVER/SOURCE
javac *.java
pause

or simply just set the sourcepath using

http://docs.oracle.com/javase/1.3/docs/tooldocs/win32/javac.html

If you use the -sourcepath option, the compiler searches the indicated path for source files; otherwise the compiler searches the user class path both for class files and source files.

an example:

@echo off

cd ./DIRECTORY/TO/YOUR/SERVER/ROOT
javac -sourcepath src *.java
pause

this also applies to class files.

-cp || -classpath

edit: i made a mistake

Read full topic
